page.title: 06A FARMER'S DAY
page.content: A farmer gets up at seven o'clock. Then he does the milking. Then he cleans out the milking parlour and all the milking things. At ten o'clock he has his breakfast. After breakfast he goes out and cuts the grass for silage. At half past twelve he has his lunch then he goes and puts the grass into rows ready to be put into bales. A man comes with a machine to put the silage into bales. After that has been done they have to move the bales. They put them into bags then it is teatime. At 6pm they do the milking then they carry on with the bales until dusk. He then watches TV and then he goes to bed.
